messages.title: Dear voter
messages.content: I am writing to ask for your support in the local and national elections. As your Green Party candidate, I am fighting for change: for an end to poverty in our city, for better housing, transport and public services, and for real democracy. With your help, I can do this from the inside too.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Laura Bannister and the Green Party want decent wages.
They aim for an end to austerity cuts.
They support a properly-funded NHS that is waiting for the Green Party.
The Green Party is fighting for better housing.
They are advocating for better transport.
Their aim includes improving public services.
Laura Bannister believes in real democracy.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In 2014 we came second across the city with 22% of the vote in Rusholme. Some people think a Green vote will let the Conservatives in, but look at the elections results on the back of this letter. People no longer trust the Lib Dems and they and the Conservatives are far behind the Green Party around here. By voting Green you have a real chance to add some diversity into Manchester's politics.

issues.economy: The people of Manchester want to 'End Cuts and Tax the Rich' (Manchester Evening News, 31st March 2015), and a recent survey confirmed that the government's cuts were not necessary and actually harmed the economy (The Independent, 1st April 2015).

housing.content: The Green Party is fighting for better housing.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am fighting for change: for an end to poverty in our city, for better housing, transport and public services, and for real democracy.

images.caption: Leaflet images depicting Laura Bannister, Green Party messaging, and voting statistics.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet shows statistical graphics regarding the underrepresentation of the Green Party in Manchester City Council and the growth in Green Party votes in local elections.
